text: Sander "Sandy" Vanocur (; born Alexander Vinocur, January 8, 1928 - September 16, 2019)Martin, Douglas. "Sander Vanocur, TV Newsman Who Covered Kennedy, Dies at 91," The New York Times, Tuesday, September 17, 2019. Retrieved September 17, 2019 was an American television journalist and actor. He was born in Cleveland, Ohio. He focused on national electoral politics. After leaving NBC in 1971, Vanocur worked for PBS and as a television writer for The Washington Post. He joined ABC News in 1977 and worked there until 1991. Vanocur hosted two of the History Channel's primetime series: Movies in Time and History's Business. His work at NBC earned him a place on the Nixon administration's "enemies list". He played himself in the 1994 television movie Without Warning. Vanocur died in Santa Barbara, California on September 16, 2019 from dementia-related problems at the age of 91. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1928 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Disease-related deaths in California Category:American television news anchors Category:American political commentators Category:American television personalities Category:American television actors Category:American movie actors Category:Writers from Cleveland Category:Actors from Cleveland
title: Sander Vanocur
